From a stay at home mom who tried to do the divorce DIY, DO NOT DO THAT. Absolutely get a lawyer. Itâ€™s about 50/50 on lawyers who charge a fee for consultations. A good lawyer is worth their weight in gold. My lawyer was amazing. I wasnâ€™t trying to fuck my ex over, I just wanted what I was legally entitled to! And I got it. I got spousal support, half of his retirement rolled into my own, 50/50 custody, etc. 

Gather as much info as you can as far as bank statements, mortgage papers, ALL debt and assets, retirement, taxes, etc. Having these will help your case. Tell your  lawyer what you want. There are protections and social services available to you, educate yourself so you can make the best decisions for you and the kids. Good luckâ¤ï¸

This is me, too. Iâ€™ve done a couple of figure competitions (you can check my post history), what you can do is back off your leg work a bit and focus more on upper body. I had two back and two shoulder days, only one leg day. I had one heavy day (rep range 4-6), and a high rep day (reps 15-30). I saw incredible growth in my lats and shoulders. 

I also backed off a lot of quad exercises and focused on hamstrings/weak gluteal points, and abs. This helped balance me out muscle-wise, so when I shredded for my competition my legs were more defined yet didnâ€™t take over my physique, and my shoulders were ğŸ˜

You look fantastic! Keep up the good work.

Nice work! Iâ€™m in recovery from alcohol abuse. Never had a problem at all with alcohol till I left my ex husband w my two kids about 3 years ago, and my addiction was full fledged. Still a struggle, but I have no desire to go back to living like that. Keep up the good work, thanks for the inspiration today.
Itâ€™s so easy to become tolerant. Give yourself a week off very now and then. It can be rough, but worth it. Your receptors just gets desensitized and they need a break.
I love Dublin. Great shot.

This is so true. We often donâ€™t see the rewards of our hard work till later, this applies to most areas in life. Yesterday I had a moment in a very stressful situation. I was tired, which makes it harder for me to regulate my emotions, and as I was in this emotional tizzy, I was able to stop and calm myself down! I breathed, consciously relaxed my shoulders. I was honestly a bit shocked at the tension that was throughout my entire body. I had never really realized it till that moment. 

Recognize the times you DO have improvements. Yesterday I thought â€œwow this is working!â€ during that situation, bc in the past I would have spent the rest of the evening, or at least hours, in that heightened emotional state. To a person without CPTSD it seems like nothing... but to me, it was a battle won. Itâ€™s good to recognize our triumphs, even if they seem small to others.

I find Zumba actually kind of difficult for me, but belly dance was my jam. I LOVE it. Itâ€™s sexy, fun, playful, and the coin scarfs are super fun. Absolutely. In now call it a gift born out of trauma... but I am rarely, if ever, wrong about people and who they really are. I can feel the moment someoneâ€™s feelings have shifted. This is from 20+ years of having to guess and pander to everyone elseâ€™s emotions. I had to predict and pamper my step mom and ex husbands every need or want, and if I didnâ€™t I would be punished. But, now i am free, and I have this amazing intuition that Iâ€™m learning to appreciate and trust.

Girl. I JUST broke up with my bf for similar reasons. The â€œsymptomsâ€ were a bit different but similar. He also just could not keep me in the loop about anything. He needs total â€œfreedom of movement,â€ doesnâ€™t matter that this means he is disrespecting my time and space. He is very selfish, but it is not my job to teach a 31y old how to balance his life. And Iâ€™m not willing to wait for him to get his shit together.

Ha! Girl just do you. Currently sitting at my desk half-working in my giant fluffy robe. Havenâ€™t washed my hair in a few days, though I did shower last night. I see nobody most days, and only see my boss couple times a week (our main office is at her house luckily). She and I sit around in our lounge wear at her place too!! Just do what you need to do. Every day could be different. We are all different people, coping in different ways. For some people getting dressed up and putting on make up brings a sense of normalcy to these strange times. But if that doesnâ€™t do it for you, no big deal. Epsom salt baths have been a life saver for me personally.

Howâ€™s that? Iâ€™m making fun of myself more than anything... Iâ€™m kinda a hermit who worked from home anyway, just live a fairly low maintenance lifestyle in general. I joined this sub to learn more about reducing waste not to judge others.

Same here. Iâ€™m 32y female, no underlying health conditions. Take no medications. Take vitamins regularly. I workout several times a week, Iâ€™m a personal trainer in addition to my day job. In addition to your symptoms I also had visual disturbances due to brain swelling, another big symptom. Also lost my sense of taste and smell for a couple days. This was this absolute sickest Iâ€™ve been since I was a child.

We are in network with BCBS and base our fee schedule off that. We often just charge people their copay/co ins on the office visit only, and the hands on work she does (like osteopathic manipulations or manual therapy) we only charge insurance. We make it affordable on a case by case basis, offering discounts and pay plans to those without insurance. We believe medical/mental health is a human right and not a product. It should be available to all, not just rich people or those with insurance.

Anyone in integrative care. I work for a family physician who takes a holistic approach and LISTENS to her patients. Our patients get an entire hour with her, sometimes more. She listens and actually cares about people.
He also will owe you 4 years of back child support.

I went solo to Prague and Dublin last year. First time in Europe, first big solo trip. I cannot tell you how grateful I am I travelled when I did. Who knows what the coming months and years will bring.

Yes thank you! I get frustrated when I see this same sentiment over and over. Eat real, whole food for a month and tell me you donâ€™t feel better. Our bodies very much react to food on a molecular level. The best Iâ€™ve ever felt in my life was eating a super clean bodybuilding diet full of fresh veggies and fruits of every color, lean meat, eggs, rice, etc, and no wheat, dairy, or sugar except occasional cheese, and one cheat meal a week. I had tons of energy, was really strong, recovered well, and my gut issues all but disappeared. Micronutrients matter too, people!

I work for an MD in a city of 300-400k. We both became very sick, doctor was worried bc she saw patients the week before. We immediately close the clinic (this was way before any mandates), she calls the CDC and her doctor friends at the hospital. She doesnâ€™t fit the CDC criteria even tho she is a provider who has had recent contact with patients. So into self quarantine we both go. 

That was over two weeks ago. After having low oxygen, tachycardia, and almost going to the ER, they finally relent and give her one of the 800 tests that was given to our state. It came back negative, but there have been many false negatives on those shot tests, plus perhaps her viral load is just low. Who knows? She and her doc friends are all certain we both have it. 

We also have many, many high risk patients who have gotten ill, all with the same/similar symptoms. Almost none of them can get tests bc they donâ€™t â€œqualify...â€ aka arenâ€™t quite sick enough. Last I heard from the hospital, which was a memo last week, there were 400 tests left in my city. They did set up one drive thru testing center, but it is a HUGE pain. 

Trump is a liar. Itâ€™s right there in black and white! I cannot comprehend the mental gymnastics it takes to hear â€œMILLIONS OF BEAUTIFUL PERFECT TESTSâ€ and then to hear, hey actually we only have 800 tests for an entire state! And we havenâ€™t received any more!!

Iâ€™m a 30 something healthy, fit, active woman, and this thing has laid me on my fucking ass. Itâ€™s been the strangest disease. Great post but you didnâ€™t mention glaciers!  There are so many glaciers you can hike to, walk on, fly too, etc. thereâ€™s Byron Glacier right outside of Anchorage. I went to Schoup Glacier and stayed at a cabin that you had to take a water taxi (or kayak) too. Really phenomenal time there. 

Iâ€™ve lived in AK for 12 years, Anchorage for most that time but also lived in Wasilla and Fairbanks. Iâ€™m a single woman who lives downtown and can verify this place is very dangerous. You will see homeless camps everywhere (thereâ€™s two huge ones within a couple hundred feet of my place). 

Keep your wits about you, especially when drinking downtown. There are regular stabbings/shootings at the bars, and clubs are constantly closing bc of the violence. You will not find the magic of Alaska in Anchorage. However like OP said thereâ€™s many, many trails. I went on Rabbit Lake Trail yesterday and it was phenomenal. The view was incredible. Anyone feel free to PM me with questions.

So when we cross over to thriving mode, all that crap weâ€™ve suppressed just to live comes bubbling up. Itâ€™s exhausting and supremely frustrating. He tries his best to assure me, and Iâ€™ll feel ok for a day or two, then the cycle happens all over again!!! 

I found the one thing that has ever really helped was tripping on mushrooms. Wow. I had a great trip, and felt AMAZING for MONTHS. Iâ€™m talking no anxiety/panic attacks, no consuming anxiety, I wasnâ€™t in my own head and freaking out over every little thing. I was more patient and kind w the kids. I have a therapeutic LSD trip planned for this weekend. Thereâ€™s a lot of research available regarding how psychedelics are very effective in treating CPTSD. I can say from personal experience itâ€™s helps.

Girl. I was in your exact situation. Two young children, he worked, wouldnâ€™t allow me to work outside the home. I fortunately still worked from home. But the more money I made the more heâ€™d make me pay towards bills. Heâ€™d go over the CC statement and go line by line and make me hand over money for food, diapers, etc. I was being abused financially, mentally, emotionally. He berated me for everything. House was dirty, kids behaved badly, my food sucked. He started eating out for every meal. Oh yeah, AND he was cheating on me w other men for our entire relationship! 

I finally couldnâ€™t handle it. I called a local abused womenâ€™s shelter and got the fuck out! I was able to live w a friend w my kids for two months while I worked my ass off to save money. If you go to a shelter they will help you fill out paperwork. I took a month of welfare, also got food stamps, child care assistance, etc. When you go to court to divorce his ass you will get alimony. Thereâ€™s also a possibility of getting him to pay for and support you while you go back to school. 

You are worth so much more than this. For your health and safety, and for your kids, you need to leave. You CAN do this. Heâ€™s told you for years how terrible you are. But guess what?? Heâ€™s a fucking liar. You are amazing and a badass, and someday you will be thriving, not just surviving.

Eat. More. You have to eat. Can a builder make a house out of nothing? No. He needs materials, wood, nails, concrete, and a million other things. Your body cannot make something out off nothing. Muscle wonâ€™t appear. You have to feed those muscles with good nutrition and shape them with weightlifting. Back off on cardio. Cardio is necessary for overall health, but if youâ€™re doing that much cardio, you need to eat even more or youâ€™re just spinning your wheels. 

I was terrified to eat more. But when I got serious about lifting I had to get serious about nutrition. A good place to start is eating 1g protein per lbs of body weight. If youâ€™re 134lbs, eat 134g protein. You can look through my post history to see my transformation. I was eating nearly 2500 cals/day and lifting 5-6 days a week with about 10-12m of HIIT cardio couple times a week. For reference Iâ€™m just under 5â€™4â€ and when transforming about 140 lbs to start. 

Also, be gentle w yourself. Building muscle, esp for women, takes time. You have a great base now of consistency, which is HUGE. I know this sub hates on personal trainers, but what took my fitness to the next level was hiring an experienced, knowledgable trainer. A good trainer will show you proper form, will push you out of your comfort zone, and will take you to the next level. I love fitness so much that at 30yrs old became a trainer myself! I love training and fitness, it completely changed my life and who I am. I have helped transform lives, and nothing has given me so much satisfaction. 

Good luck lady. Remember fitness is a marathon, not a sprint. At leas than a year in you are doing great! Now itâ€™s time to take it up a notch. Youâ€™ve got this!!!
Donâ€™t stop being who you are. Youâ€™re perfect. Donâ€™t sacrifice the very core of who you are for anyone. â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

Honestly, people just have to find out for themselves. You have to be ready to make that change. And it takes trial and error. Does she have binge eating disorder? Itâ€™s possible she DOES eat 1k calories a day but then has huge binges that puts her over. Classic restrict/binge cycle. Be gentle and be there for her. Someday hopefully itâ€™ll click for her. Iâ€™m a personal trainer and I canâ€™t tell you how many clients I have that SWEAR up and down they â€œeat healthyâ€ yet are overweight or obese. They neglect to acknowledge that they drink frappes from Starbucks every morning, or drink and eat excessively on weekends. I canâ€™t force anyone. All I can do is gently ask questions from time to time and lead them to the answer in a roundabout way. When you confront someone head on they will become defensive and possibly cut you out. Just continue to be her friend and if she asks questions about how youâ€™re able to lose and she canâ€™t, ask how she does on the weekends or when sheâ€™s stressed, etc. just be her friend.
